pyLCM.utility package

Submodules

pyLCM.utility.Reynolds module

pyLCM.utility.Reynolds.reynolds_number(velocity, density, viscosity, length)[source]

Calculate Reynolds number for a given velocity field.

Parameters:
velocity: float

velocity field

density: float

density of fluid

viscosity: float

dynamic viscosity of fluid

length: float

characteristic length

Returns:
Reynolds number

pyLCM.utility.fiber_volume_fraction module

pyLCM.utility.fiber_volume_fraction.preform_vf(areal_density, n_layers, thickness)[source]

Calculate the fiber volume fraction of a preform according to areal density, number of layers and thickness of the preform.

Parameters:
areal_densityfloat or list of float

Areal density of the reinforcement textile.

n_layersint

Number of layers of reinforcement textile in the preform.

thicknessfloat

Thickness of the preform.

Returns:
vffloat

Fiber volume fraction of the preform.

pyLCM.utility.fiber_volume_fraction.solid_vf(volume_tows, volume_total)[source]

Calculate the solid volume fraction (the fiber tows are regared as solid) of a given volume (unit cell). The result can also be interpreted as the complementary of the volume fraction of meso-pores between the fiber tows. Namely, the solid volume fraction = 1 - volume fraction of meso-pores.

Parameters:
volume_towsfloat or list of float

Volume of the fiber tows which are regared as solid.

volume_totalfloat

Volume of the composite.

Returns:
vffloat or list of float

Solid volume fraction of given volume.

pyLCM.utility.fiber_volume_fraction.tex_to_area(tex, density_fiber=2550)[source]

Calculate the cross section area of fibers containing in a tow according to the tow linear density in tex and the fiber diameter. Where:

1 tex = 1/1000 * kg/km

Parameters:
texfloat

Tow linear density in tex.

density_fiberfloat

Density of the fiber in kg/m^3.

Returns:
areafloat

Cross section area of fibers containing in a tow in mm^2.

pyLCM.utility.fiber_volume_fraction.tow_vf(tow_cross_section_area, n_fibers, d_fiber, physical_checking=False)[source]

Calculate the fiber volume fraction of a fiber tow according to fiber numbers it containing and the fiber diameter.

Parameters:
tow_cross_section_areafloat or list of float

Cross section area of the fiber tow.

n_fibersint

Number of fibers in the tow.

d_fiberfloat

Diameter of the fiber.

physical_checkingbool, optional

If True, the fiber volume fraction will be checked to be in the range of 0 to 0.907 for hexagonal close packing. The default is False.

Returns:
vffloat or list of float

local fiber volume fractions of the fiber tow.
